classRec.name: Device3D
classRec.description: The Device3D class manages the main configuration, states and data processing.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: maxBonesPerVertex
method.description:
Sets and returns the maximum number of bones per vertex (1 to 4).
This property works as a global configuration, and should be defined before creating the scene.

field.name: bones
field.description: Buffer used to store bones transformations.

field.name: cameraGlobal
field.description: Current view matrix. This property is automatically set during the rendereing process.

field.name: camera
field.description: Current rendering camera. This property is automatically set during the rendereing process.

field.name: defaultCullFace
field.description: The default cull face mode to use when some material is created.

field.name: defaultDestFactor
field.description: The default destination factor to use when some material is created.

field.name: defaultSourceFactor
field.description: The default source factor to use when some material is created.

field.name: drawCalls
field.description: The number of draw operations of the last frame.

field.name: frameCount
field.description: The ammount of frames rendered.

field.name: global
field.description: Global matrix of current rendering object. This property is automatically set during the rendereing process.

field.name: ignoreStates
field.description:
This property sets if materials should use define render states.
If it is sets to false, all blending states, culling, depth testing, masks and scissors are ignored and is to
the user to set the state manually.
This may be used in cases where an user defined pass needs to be drawn and an specific state is required.
All textures, constants parameters and surface buffers will still be defined by the engine.

field.name: invGlobal
field.description: Inverse global matrix of current rendering object. This property is automatically set during the rendereing process.

field.name: invertCullMode
field.description:
Allow to invert the culling state.
This property may be used when drawing mirros for example.

field.name: lastMaterial
field.description:
Sets or gets the last used material.
This value is used by the engine to clear only the necesary states.

field.name: maxBonesPerSurface
field.description:
The maximim number of bones per surface.
This value should not be changed if it is not really necesary, it could affect dramatically the performance and stability of the engine.

field.name: maxTextureSize
field.description: The maximum texture size allowed.

field.name: objectsDrawn
field.description: The number of objects that was drawn on the last frame.

field.name: profile
field.description:
Defines which profile will be used when the context is created.
This property should be set before the scene context is created.

field.name: proj
field.description: Current projection matrix. This property is automatically set during the rendereing process.

field.name: scene
field.description: Current scene. This property is automatically set during the rendereing process.

field.name: trianglesDrawn
field.description: The number of triangles drawn on the last frame.

field.name: usedBuffers
field.description:
Sets or gets the amount of used buffers in last draw call.
This value is used by the engine to clear only the necesary states.

field.name: usedSamples
field.description:
Sets or gets the amount of used samples in last draw call.
This value is used by the engine to clear only the necesary states.

field.name: viewPort
field.description: Current viewport rectangle. This property is automatically set during the rendereing process.

field.name: viewProj
field.description: Current view-projection matrix. This property is automatically set during the rendereing process.

field.name: view
field.description: Current inverted view matrix. This property is automatically set during the rendereing process.

field.name: worldViewProj
field.description: Current world-view-projection matrix. This property is automatically set during the rendereing process.

field.name: worldView
field.description: Current world-view matrix. This property is automatically set during the rendereing process.

classRec.name: Input3D
classRec.description:
The Input3D class manages keyboard and mouse inputs.

Download example - 05 - keyboard input.zip
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: initialize
method.description: Initializes the Input3D class. This method is automatically called when a new scene is created.
method.param: stage Stage container object.

method.name: keyDown
method.description: Returns 'true' all the time the specified key is being pressed.
method.param: keyCode Code of the key to be tested.
method.return: 'true' if it is pressed.

method.name: keyHit
method.description:
Returns 'true' if the specified key has been pressed. Unlike the keyDown method, this method will return
'true' only in the first test. Then it will return 'false' until the key is released, thus avoiding repetitions.
method.param: keyCode Code of the key to be tested.
method.return: 'true' if it is pressed.

method.name: reset
method.description: Resets all Input states.

method.name: update
method.description: Updates keyboard and mouse inputs. This method is automatically called by the scene.

method.name: delta
method.description: Returns a count of the number of detents the mouse wheel has rotated.

method.name: doubleClickEnabled
method.description: Returns or sets whether the double-click detection mode is enabled. The default value is 'false'.

method.name: keyCode
method.description: Returns the key code of the last pressed key.

method.name: middleMouseDown
method.description: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button is pressed.

method.name: middleMouseHit
method.description: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button has been pressed.

method.name: middleMouseUp
method.description: Returns a number greater than zero when the mouse button is released after clicking.

method.name: mouseDobleClick
method.description: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button has been double clicked.

method.name: mouseDown
method.description: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button is pressed.

method.name: mouseHit
method.description: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button has been pressed.

method.name: mouseMoved
method.description: Returns whatever the mouse was moved.

method.name: mouseUp
method.description: Returns a number greater than zero when the mouse button is released after clicking.

method.name: mouseXSpeed
method.description: Returns the displacement of the mouse on the X axis starting from the position of the last frame.

method.name: mouseX
method.description: Returns the position of the mouse on the X axis.

method.name: mouseYSpeed
method.description: Returns the displacement of the mouse on the Y axis starting from the position of the last frame.

method.name: mouseY
method.description: Returns the position of the mouse on the Y axis.

method.name: rightClickEnabled
method.description: Returns or sets whether the right-click detection mode is enabled. The default value is 'false'.

method.name: rightMouseDown
method.description: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button is pressed.

method.name: rightMouseHit
method.description: Returns a number greater than zero if the mouse button has been pressed.

method.name: rightMouseUp
method.description: Returns a number greater than zero when the mouse button is released after clicking.

classRec.name: Library3D
classRec.description: The Library3D class loads and manages the resources used by 3d objects.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

Event.name: ioError
Event.description: Dispatched if a call to load() results in a fatal error that terminates the download.

Event.name: progress
Event.description: This event occurs whenever the loading progress of the elements of a library is modified.

Event.name: complete
Event.description: This event occurs once the loading process of all the library elements has been completed.

Event.name: updated
Event.description: This event occurs when the library has been updated.

method.name: Library3D
method.description: Creates a new library object.
method.param: connections The number of connections used for download at the same time.
autoStart Define if the library starts automatically to download the files when the first file is added.
allowEventsAfterComplete Allow to fire events (progress and complete) after the first complete events. It can be used to load multiple packages.

method.name: addItem
method.description:
Adds a new item to the library. This method asociates the item instance to a key-path to be used with the getItem() method.
Also adds the item to a collecion of items.
method.param: path Path or key to associate the item.
item The item instance.

method.name: close
method.description: Closes all connections.

method.name: dispose
method.description: Eliminates cached resources.

method.name: getItem
method.description: Returns an item instance previosuly associated to a path.
method.param: path Path of the item instance.
method.return: The item corresponding to the path, null othwrwise.

method.name: load
method.description:
Start downloading.
If autoStart propery was seted to true in the constructor, this method will be automatically called when loads the first file.

method.name: push
method.description: Loads a new item object. If the item can not be loaded inmediately (depending of the amount of available connections), it will be added to a queue to be load when connections are available.
method.return: true if was sucesful, false otherwise.

method.name: reset
method.description: Removes all items and clean all references.

method.name: bytesLoaded
method.description: Returns the amount of bytes loaded.

method.name: bytesTotal
method.description: Returns the amount of bytes that will be loaded.

method.name: itemsToLoad
method.description: Returns a copy of the stored items to be loaded.

method.name: items
method.description: Returns a copy of the stored items.

method.name: progress
method.description:
Returns the global progress of all the resources being currently loaded.
Once the 'complete' event has been received, it will be set back to zero and a new progress stage will begin if new resources are loaded only if allowEventsAfterComplete is seted to true in the class constructor,

method.name: allowEventsAfterComplete
method.description: Allow to fire events (progress and complete) after the first complete event were dispatched. It can be used to load multiple packages.

classRec.name: Vector3DUtils
classRec.description: The Vector3DUtils class contains help tools to work with Vector3D-type objects.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: add
method.description: Calculates the sum of two vectors.
method.param: a First vector.
b Second vector.
out Vector3D-type object where the result is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' parameter is 'null', a new Vector3D with the result will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: cross
method.description: Calculates the crossed product of two vectors.
method.param: a First vector to be tested.
b Second vector to be tested.
out Vector3D-type object where the result is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' parameter is 'null', a new Vector3D with the result will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: interpolate
method.description: Calculates the interpolation between two vectors.
method.param: a Source vector.
b Destination vector.
value Interpolation value (0-1).
out Vector where the result is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' parameter is 'null', a new Vector3D with the result will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: lengthSquared
method.description: Calculates the squared length between two vectors.
method.param: a First vector to be tested.
b Second vector to be tested.
method.return: Distance aquared between vectors 'a' and 'b'.

method.name: length
method.description: Calculates the length between two vectors.
method.param: a First vector to be tested.
b Second vector to be tested.
method.return: Distance between vectors 'a' and 'b'.

method.name: mirror
method.description: Returns the vector mirrored with respect to another.
method.param: vector Source vector that is to be mirrored.
normal Plane normal on which the source vector is to be mirrored.
out Vector where the result is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' parameter is 'null', a new Vector3D with the result will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: negate
method.description: Calculates the inverse vector of another vector.
method.param: a Vector to be tested.
out Vector where the result is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' parameter is 'null', a new Vector3D with the result will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: random
method.description: Fills a vector with random numbers in a defined range.
method.param: min Minimum number that values can hold.
max Maximum number that values can hold.
out Vector where the result is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' parameter is 'null', a new Vector3D with the result will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: setLength
method.description: Sets a scale for a vector.
method.param: a Vector whose scale is to be set.
length Scale to be set.

method.name: sub
method.description: Calculates the subtraction of two vectors.
method.param: a First vector.
b Second vector.
out Vector3D-type object where the result is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' parameter is 'null', a new Vector3D with the result will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: set
method.description: Sets the values for a vector.
method.param: a Vector to be set.
x X component of the vector.
y Y component of the vector.
z Z component fo the vector.

field.name: BACK
field.description: Vector that defines the (0,0,-1) constant.

field.name: DOWN
field.description: Vector that defines the (0,-1,0) constant.

field.name: FORWARD
field.description: Vector that defines the (0,0,1) constant.

field.name: LEFT
field.description: Vector that defines the (-1,0,0) constant.

field.name: ONE
field.description: Vector that defines the (1,1,1) constant.

field.name: RIGHT
field.description: Vector that defines the (1,0,0) constant.

field.name: UP
field.description: Vector that defines the (0,1,0) constant.

field.name: ZERO
field.description: Vector that defines the (0,0,0) constant.

classRec.name: Matrix3DUtils
classRec.description: The Matrix3DUtils class contains help tools to work with Matrix3D-type objects.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: deltaTransformVector
method.description: Transforms a given point multiplying it by a matrix, but without considering translation.
method.param: m Matrix that will be used to transform the point.
v Vector3D that represents the point to be transformed.
out Vector3D where the transformed point is to be returned.

method.name: equal
method.description: Returns 'true' if 'a' and 'b' matrices are equal.
method.param: a First matrix to be compared.
b Second matrix to be compared.
method.return: 'true' if they are equal.

method.name: getBackward
method.description: Returns the direction vector pointing to the back side of the matrix.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
out Output vector3D where the direction of the right vector of the matrix is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' parameter is 'null', a new Vector3D with the direccion will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: getDir
method.description: Returns the direccin vector pointing to the front side of the matrix.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
out Output vector3D where the direction of the front vector of the matrix is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' parameter is 'null', a new Vector3D with the direction will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: getDown
method.description: Returns the direccin vector pointing to the bottom side of the matrix.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
out Output vector3D where the direction of the front vector of the matrix is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' parameter is 'null', a new Vector3D with the direction will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: getLeft
method.description: Returns the direccin vector pointing to the left side of the matrix.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
out Output vector3D where the direction of the front vector of the matrix is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' parameter is 'null', a new Vector3D with the direction will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: getPosition
method.description: Returns a matrix position.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
out Output vector3D where the matrix position is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' is 'null', a new Vector3D with the position will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: getRight
method.description: Returns the direction vector pointing to the right side of the matrix.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
out Output vector3D where the direction of the right vector of the matrix is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' parameter is 'null', a new Vector3D with the direccion will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: getRotation
method.description: Returns the current rotation of the object in euler angles.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
out Output vector3D where the matrix rotation is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' parameter is 'null', a new Vector3D with the rotation will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: getScale
method.description: Returns a matrix scale.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
out Output vector3D where the matrix scale is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' parameter is 'null', a new vector3D with the scale will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: getUp
method.description: Returns the direction vector pointing to the upper side of the matrix.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
out Output vector3D where the direction of the upper vector of the matrix is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' parameter is 'null', a new Vector3D with the direction will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: invert
method.description: Inverts a matrix3D.
method.param: m Matrix to be inverted.
out Matrix where the inverted matrix is returned.
method.return: If the 'out' is 'null', a new matrix will be returned. Otherwise, the same matrix, passed to the 'out' parameter, will be returned.

method.name: lookAt
method.description: Directs the object towards the specified position. Coordinates are related to the local space of the object.
method.param: m Marix to be tested.
x Position on x
y Position on Y
z Position on z
up Vector3D related to the direction of the upper side of the object. The default value is (0, 1, 0).
smooth Optional interpolation value towards final transformation (0-1).

method.name: resetPosition
method.description: Resets the matrix position. The position is to be set to (0,0,0).
method.param: m Matrix whose position is to be reset.

method.name: resetRotation
method.description: Resets the matrix rotation. The rotation is to be set to (0,0,0).
method.param: m Matrix whose rotation is to be reset.

method.name: resetScale
method.description: Resets a matrix scale. The scale is to be set to (1,1,1).
method.param: m Matrix whose scale is to be reset.

method.name: rotateAxis
method.description:
Rotates the object on the specified axis from its current position.
The pivotPoint parameter can be used to rotate around a point.
method.param: m Source Matrix3D.
angle Angles to be rotated.
axis Direction vector or axis on which to rotate.
pivotPoint Position vector that sets an anchoring point for rotation. The position must be expressed in local units.

method.name: rotateX
method.description:
Rotates the matrix on the X axis from its current position.
The pivotPoint parameter can be used to rotate around a point.
method.param: m Source Matrix3D.
angle Angles to be rotated.
local true to rotate respecting current orientation, or false to rotate according to orientation relative to parent.
pivotPoint Position vector that sets an anchoring point for rotation. The position must be expressed in local units.

method.name: rotateY
method.description:
Rotates the matrix on the Y axis from its current position.
The pivotPoint parameter can be used to rotate around a point.
method.param: m Source Matrix3D.
angle Angles to be rotated.
local true to rotate respecting current orientation, or false to rotate according to orientation relative to parent.
pivotPoint Position vector that sets an anchoring point for rotation. The position must be expressed in local units.

method.name: rotateZ
method.description:
Rotates the matrix on the Z axis from its current position.
The pivotPoint parameter can be used to rotate around a point.
method.param: m Source Matrix3D.
angle Angles to be rotated.
local true to rotate respecting current orientation, or false to rotate according to orientation relative to parent.
pivotPoint Position vector that sets an anchoring point for rotation. The position must be expressed in local units.

method.name: scaleX
method.description:
Increases or decreases the matrix scale on the X axis.
Use a value greater than one to increase or less than one to decrease.
Setting the scale to 2 means that objects will be scaled to twice their original size, whereas a value of 0.5 would scale objects to one half of their original size.
method.param: m Soruce Matrix3D object.
scale Scale value.

method.name: scaleY
method.description:
Increases or decreases the matrix scale on the Y axis.
Use a value greater than one to increase or less than one to decrease.
Setting the scale to 2 means that objects will be scaled to twice their original size, whereas a value of 0.5 would scale objects to one half of their original size.
method.param: m Soruce Matrix3D object.
scale Scale value.

method.name: scaleZ
method.description:
Increases or decreases the matrix scale on the Z axis.
Use a value greater than one to increase or less than one to decrease.
Setting the scale to 2 means that objects will be scaled to twice their original size, whereas a value of 0.5 would scale objects to one half of their original size.
method.param: m Soruce Matrix3D object.
scale Scale value.

method.name: setNormalOrientation
method.description: Aligns the object to a normal.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
normal Normal used for alignment.
smooth Optional interpolation value (0-1).

method.name: setOrientation
method.description: Orients the object in a specific direction.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
dir Direction set for orientation.
up Upper side of the object. The default value is (0,1,0).
smooth Optional interpolation value (0-1).

method.name: setPosition
method.description: Returns a matrix position.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
out Output vector3D where the matrix position is to be returned.
method.return: If the 'out' is 'null', a new Vector3D with the position will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector passed to the 'out' parameter will be returned.

method.name: setRotation
method.description: Rotates a matrix using euler angles. Rotation is absolute; therefore, any previous rotation is to be omitted.
method.param: m Matrix to be rotated.
x Rotation on X axis in angles.
y Rotation on Y axis in angles.
z Rotation on Z axis in angles.

method.name: setScale
method.description:
Sets the object scale. This method sets the scale in an absolute manner; therefore, any previous scale will be ignored.
Default value is 1, use a value greater than one to increase or less than 1 to decrease the scale.
Setting the scale to 2 means that objects will be scaled to twice their original size, whereas a value of 0.5 would scale objects to one half of their original size.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
x Scale on x
y Scale on y
z Scale on z

method.name: setTranslation
method.description: Translates the object from its current position to the specified distance.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
x Distance in units to translate on X axis.
y Distance in units to translate on Y axis.
z Distance in units to translate on Z axis.
local true to translate respecting current orientation or false to translate on the coordinates relative to the parent.

method.name: setVectors
method.description: Construct a matrix using vectors.
method.param: m Matrix to construct.
right Right vector.
up Up vector.
dir Dir vector.

method.name: transformVector
method.description: Transforms a given point multiplying it by a matrix.
method.param: m Matrix that will be used to transform the point.
v Vector3D that represents the point to be transformed.
out out Vector3D where the transformed point is to be returned.

method.name: translateAxis
method.description: Translates the object on a certain axis from its current position.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
distance Distance to translate.
axis Direction vector or axis on which to translate.

method.name: translateX
method.description: Translates the object on the X axis from its current position.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
distance Distance to translate.
local true to translate respecting current orientation, or false to translate on the coordinates relative to parent.

method.name: translateY
method.description: Translates the object on the Y axis from its current position.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
distance Distance to translate.
local true to translate respecting current orientation, or false to translate on the coordinates relative to parent.

method.name: translateZ
method.description: Translates the object on the Z axis from its current position.
method.param: m Matrix to be tested.
distance Distance to translate.
local true to translate respecting current orientation, or false to translate on the coordinates relative to parent.

classRec.name: Texture3DUtils
classRec.description: The Texture3DUtils class contains help tools to work with Texture3D or BitmapData-type objects.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

classRec.name: Surface3DUtils
classRec.description: The Surface3DUtils class contains help tools to work with Surface3D-type objects.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

classRec.name: Mesh3DUtils
classRec.description: The Mesh3DUtils class contains help tools to work with Mesh3D-type objects.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: split
method.description: Split the surfaces of the mesh if they exceds the limit of the buffer size.
method.param: mesh The mess to be splited.

classRec.name: Pivot3DUtils
classRec.description: The Pivot3DUtils class contains help tools to work with Pivot3D-type objects.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: appendAnimation
method.description:
Add animation frames and labels to source pivot from another pivot, including children.

The pivot names and hierarchy must be the same.
method.param: dest Pivot who want to append the animations.
animation The pivot that contains the animations to add to dest pivot.
label Optionally, you can set a new label name to define the appened animation.
includeMaterials If materials has animated parameters, they will be append.

method.name: getChildByNameAux
method.description: Returns the first child or bone that matches the specified name.

method.name: getDistance
method.description: Returns the distance between two objects. This method uses the global space of the scene.
method.param: pivot1 First object to be tested.
pivot2 Second object to be tested.
method.return: Distance between the two objects.

method.name: lookAtWithReference
method.description: Points the object direction towards a given position using a reference object. The coordinates used correspond to the local space of the 'reference' parameter.
method.param: x Reference object position on the x axis.
y Reference object position on the Y axis.
z Reference object position on the Z axis.
reference Object to be used as referente for "x", "y" and "z" parameters.
up Vector3D corresponding to the direction of the object upper side. If omitted, the default value (0, 1, 0) will be used.
smooth Optional interpolation value towards final transformation (0-1).

method.name: setPositionWithReference
method.description: Positions an object using another as reference.
method.param: pivot Object to be positioned.
x Reference object position on the X axis.
y Reference object position on the Y axis.
z Reference object position on the Z axis.
reference Object to be used as reference.
smooth Optional interpolation value towards final transformation (0-1).

method.name: traceInfo
method.description: Returns information about an object and its properties at the Flash output.
method.param: pivot Object to be tested.
includeMaterials 'true' if information about the materials is to be included.
includeChildren 'true' if all the hierarchy is to be included.

classRec.name: Spline3D
classRec.description: The Spline3D class represents a 3d spline.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: Spline3D
method.description: Creates a new spline.

method.name: clone
method.description: Creates a copy of the spline.
method.return: The new copy of the spline.

method.name: getPoint
method.description: Returns the position on the spline depending on the value parameter.
method.param: value 0 to 1 value that represents the position in time on the spline.
out Vector where the position will be returned.
method.return: If an 'out' value has been specified, the same object is returned. Otherwise, a new vector with the position is returned.

method.name: getTangent
method.description: Returns the direction on the spline in a given position.
method.param: value 0 to 1 value that represents the position in time on the spline.
out Vector where the direction will be returned.
method.return: If an 'out' value has been specified, the same object is returned. Otherwise, a new vector with the position is returned.

method.name: closed
method.description: Returns or sets whether this is a closed spline. In that case, the last Knot3D will be joined to the first.

field.name: knots
field.description: Knot3D-type vector with the spline knots.

method.name: closetPoint
method.description: Returns the closest point belonging to the polygon of the point given by the 'p' parameter.
method.param: p Point to be tested.
out Point belonging to the polygon that is closest to the 'p' parameter.

method.name: getPointU
method.description: Returns the coordinate on the polygon horizontal axis of the last call to getPoint.
method.return: The polygon horizontal coordinate.

method.name: getPointV
method.description: Returns the coordinate on the polygon vertical axis of the last call to getPoint.
method.return: The polygon vertical coordinate.

method.name: inView
method.description: Returns whether the object should be drawn. The property usually uses a Boundings3D-class values and determines whether it is visible or not based on the object radius. Therefore, the returned value is only an approximation.

classRec.name: Boundings3D
classRec.description:
The Boundings3D class has the information about Pivot3D-type object dimensions.

The values established in this class will not affect objects physically; they are just informative.

The values returned are represented in the local space of each object. To transform them to a global space use localToGlobal or localToGlobalVector of the Pivot3D objects.

Although values can be modified, this is not advisable as these properties are often used by the visibility and collision calculation system, for example. Preferably, create a copy using the clone system and modify that copy.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: Boundings3D
method.description: Creates a new Boundings3D object.

method.name: clone
method.description: Creates a copy of a Boundings3D object.
method.return: Returns a new Boundings3D object.

method.name: reset
method.description: Resets the object properties to its default values.

field.name: center
field.description: Center of the object. The center does not correspond to (0,0,0) of the object, but it is the calculated center of all the vertices.

field.name: length
field.description: Lengths of the bounding box of the object. (Maximum corner minus minimum corner).

field.name: max
field.description: Maximum corner of the bounding box of the object.

field.name: min
field.description: Minimum corner of the bounding box of the object.

field.name: radius
field.description: Radius of the object count from the center of the object (not from the object).

classRec.name: Label3D
classRec.description: The Label3D class defines labels to be used for 3d object animation.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: Label3D
method.description: Creates a new Label3D object.
method.param: name Animation name.
from Frame where animation begins. The frame number is zero-based.
to Frame where animation ends. The frame number is zero-based.

method.name: length
method.description: Returns the length of the animation label.

field.name: from
field.description: Frame where animation begins. The frame number is zero-based.

field.name: name
field.description: Name given to the animation.

field.name: to
field.description: Frame where animation ends. The frame number is zero-based.

classRec.name: ParticleInit3D
classRec.description: The ParticleInit3D class defines a structure to use for particles initialization.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: ParticleInit3D
method.description: Creates a new particles initialization class.

field.name: position
field.description: The position of the particle.

field.name: scale
field.description: The scale of the particle.

field.name: spin
field.description: The spin value of the particle.

field.name: velocity
field.description: The velocity of the particle.

classRec.name: Knot3D
classRec.description:
The Knot3D class defines points for the splines (Spline3D).

Knot3D objects not only define the points as vertices do in a mesh, but also define control points to generate and move bezier curves through inVec and outVec vectors.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: Knot3D
method.description: Creates a new Knot3D.

method.name: clone
method.description: Returns a copy of Knot3D.
method.return: a new Knot3D.

field.name: inVec
field.description: Input vector for splines (Spline3D)

field.name: outVec
field.description: Output vector for splines (Spline3D)

classRec.name: Surface3D
classRec.description: The Surface3D class represents a set of vertices, polygons and surfaces which can be drawn.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: Surface3D
method.description: Creates a new Surface3D object.

method.name: addVertexData
method.description:
Define a new attribute for each vertex. Each attribute can be a vector of 1-4 values (flotas) associated to each vertex.

The vertexVector can be for example: x,y,z,nx,ny,nz,u,v, x,y,z,nx,ny,nz,u,v, x,y,z,nx,ny,nz,u,v...
method.param: dataIndex A value from 0 to 7 that define the type of data to be assocciated. The common values may be one of the POSITION, NORMALS, UV0, UV1, etc. constans of the Surface3D class.
size The size of data associated to the attribute for each vertex (1 to 4).

method.name: indexVector
method.description: Vector of indices that reference to a vertex buffers of the Surface3D.

method.name: instanceOf
method.description: Gets or sets the instance reference of the surface if there is one.

method.name: vertexVector
method.description: Vector of vertices that reference to a vertex buffers of the Surface3D.

method.name: material
method.description: Material instance to render the surface.

field.name: BITANGENT
field.description: Vertex bi-tangents attribute (float3).

field.name: COLOR0
field.description: Vertex color attribute (float3).

field.name: COLOR1
field.description: Vertex color attribute (float3).

field.name: COLOR2
field.description: Vertex color attribute (float3).

field.name: NORMAL
field.description: Vertex normals attribute (float3).

field.name: PARTICLE
field.description: Vertex particles attribute (float4). Life (0-1), rotation in radians and size x and y (-1 to 1).

field.name: POSITION
field.description: Vertex position attribute (float3).

field.name: SKIN_INDICES
field.description: Vertex skin indices attribute (could be float1 to float4 depending of the Device3D.maxBonesPerVertex property).

field.name: SKIN_WEIGHTS
field.description: Vertex skin weights attribute (could be float1 to float4 depending of the Device3D.maxBonesPerVertex property).

field.name: TANGENT
field.description: Vertex tangents attribute (float3).

field.name: TARGET_NORMAL
field.description: Vertex target normal attribute (float3).

field.name: TARGET_POSITION
field.description: Vertex target position attribute (float3).

field.name: UV0
field.description: Vertex primary uv channel attribute (flaot2).

field.name: UV1
field.description: Vertex secondary uv channel attribute (float2).

field.name: UV2
field.description: Vertex third uv channel attribute (float2).

field.name: UV3
field.description: Vertex four uv channel attribute (float2).

field.name: bounds
field.description: Returns or sets a Boundings3D object with object properties, such as radius, dimensions, etc.

field.name: firstIndex
field.description: The index of the first vertex index selected to render.

field.name: format
field.description: The buffer format specified for each input.

field.name: indexBuffer
field.description: Buffer of indices that reference to a vertex buffers of the Surface3D.

field.name: indexBytes
field.description: Vector of indices that reference to a vertex buffers of the Surface3D.

field.name: name
field.description: The name of the surface.

field.name: numTriangles
field.description: Number of triangles that will be drawn.

field.name: offset
field.description: The offset of data index in the vertexVector.

field.name: scene
field.description:
Gets the scene context of the surface.
Do not change this property manually, to change the scene context, call to download() and then to upload() methods.

field.name: sizePerVertex
field.description: The number of data values associated with each vertex

field.name: sources
field.description: The surface sources of data index from where the input should be read. A null value means the same surface.

field.name: vertexBuffer
field.description: Buffer of vertices that reference to a vertex buffers of the Surface3D.

field.name: vertexBytes
field.description: Vector of vertices that reference to a vertex buffers of the Surface3D.

classRec.name: Texture3D
classRec.description: The Textrue3D class contains information on material textures.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: Texture3D
method.description:
Creates a new texture. The 'request' parameter can be a url string path, URLRequest, BitmapData or a Point object to create a dynamic texture.
If a path is set for the texture, the Texture3D object will start its loading process. If no path is set for the texture,
a BitmapData object that has been directly loaded can be specified.
method.param: request It can be texture file path or BitmapData object.

method.name: close
method.description: Terminates the loading proccess.

method.name: dispose
method.description:
Eliminates all the resources associated to the texture.
The texture will be unusable after dispose.

method.name: download
method.description: Download the texture from the graphics card.

method.name: load
method.description: Loads the texture if it is an external resource..

method.name: upload
method.description: Upload the texture to the graphics card.
method.param: scene The scene to use as a context.
method.return: true if was uploaded, false otherwise.

method.name: loaded
method.description: Returns if the texture was succesfull loaded and ready to use.

method.name: optimizeForRenderToTexture
method.description: Returns whatever the texture is optimized for dynamic rendering.

method.name: request
method.description: Gets a reference to the request object.

field.name: bias
field.description: Defines how the mip levels will be applied over the texture. Value should be between -127 and 127.

field.name: bitmapData
field.description: BitmapData object that contains the texture data.

field.name: filterMode
field.description:
Defines how the texture will be sampled when it needs to be streched on the screen.
This property should be defined before the shader compilation.
Setting to Texture3D.FILTER_NEAREST will take the nearest pixel.
Setting to Texture3D.FILTER_LINEAR will take an interpolation between the nearest pixels.

field.name: mipMode
field.description:
Defines if the texture will use mip mapping and how it will be applyied.
This property should be defined before the shader compilation.
Setting to Texture3D.MIP_NEAREST, uses the pixel from the nearest mipmap level.
Setting to Texture3D.MIP_LINEAR uses the pixel from two nearest mipmap levels, and interpolates linearly.
Setting to Texture3D.MIP_NONE will disable mip mode for the texture.

field.name: name
field.description: The name of the texture.

field.name: scene
field.description:
Gets the scene context of the texture.
Do not change this property manually, to change the scene context, call to download() and then to upload() methods.

field.name: texture
field.description: Texture object that contains the texture data on graphics card.

field.name: typeMode
field.description: Defines the type of the texture (2d/cube).

field.name: uploadTexture
field.description: Allow you to define a custom function to generate and upload the texture.

field.name: wrapMode
field.description:
Defines how the texture will be sampled outside the normalized coordinates (0-1).
This property should be defined before the shader compilation.
Setting to WRAP_REPEAT, the texture will repeat to the infinity.
Setting to WRAP_CLAMP, the last pixel of the texture image stretches to the infinity.

classRec.name: Pivot3D
classRec.description:
The Pivot3D class is the most basic three-dimensional element.

Represents a point, its orientation and scale in the 3d space.

The Pivot3D object can also be parent or container of other 3d objects and can be animated.

Event.name: exitDrag
Event.description: This event occurs after drag the object.

Event.name: enterDrag
Event.description: This event occurs before drag the object.

Event.name: changeTransform
Event.description: This event occurs whatever the object changes his position, rotation or scale.

Event.name: unload
Event.description: This event occurs when the dispose method of the object itself or of a parent object is called.

Event.name: exitDraw
Event.description: This event occurs after draw the object.

Event.name: enterDraw
Event.description: This event occurs before draw the object.

Event.name: exitFrame
Event.description: This event occurs after updating every frame.

Event.name: enterFrame
Event.description: This event occurs before entering any frame.

Event.name: removed
Event.description: This event occurs when the object is removed from a scene or from any other object.

Event.name: removedFromScene
Event.description: This event occurs when the object is removed from a scene.

Event.name: addedToScene
Event.description: This event occurs when the object is added to a scene.

Event.name: added
Event.description: This event occurs when the object is added to a scene or to any other object.

Event.name: animationComplete
Event.description: This event occurs at the end of an animation.

method.name: Pivot3D
method.description: Creates a new Pivot3D object.
method.param: name 3d object name.

method.name: addChild
method.description: Add a new object as a child.
method.param: pivot Object to be added.
method.return: The object that has been added.

method.name: addComponent
method.description: Adds a new component to the object.
method.param: component The component to add.
method.return: 'true' is the component was sucesfully added, 'false' otherwise.

method.name: addLabel
method.description: Adds a label that refers to a given animation.
method.param: label Label3D object.
includeChildren true if labels are to be included in all the sub-objects.
method.return: Returns same Label3D object that contains the label information.

method.name: clone
method.description: Creates a copy of the object and all its elements.
method.return: A new Pivot3D object.

method.name: copyFrom
method.description: Copy basic pivot properties to anotheer pivot.

method.name: copyTransformFrom
method.description: Copies all transformations (position, rotation and scale) from another Pivot3D object.
method.param: source Source object from you want to copy.
local true to copy from/to local coordinates, false will take global space coordinates.

method.name: dispose
method.description: Disposes the pivot and all associated resources.

method.name: draw
method.description:
Draws the object. This method is generally called by the scene that contains it and manages it. However, it is possible to manage the drawing process independently from a scene.
To do so, it is essential that the canvas and the camera be properly set in the Device3D class and that the calculateView method of the Camera3D class be previously called.

method.name: forEach
method.description: Excecutes a calback functions for each of his children. The callback should recibe a object:Pivot3D parameter.
method.param: callback
includeChildren

method.name: getBackward
method.description: Returns the direction vector that points to the back of the object.
method.return: The new direction vector.

method.name: getChildByName
method.description: Returns the first child that matches the specified name.
method.param: name Name of the object to be searched for.
startIndex An optional integer specifying the starting index of the search.
includeChildren true to extend the search to all the hierarchy.
method.return: The object that matches the specified name.

method.name: getDir
method.description: Returns the direction vector that points to the front of the object.
method.return: The new direction vector.

method.name: getDown
method.description: Returns the direction vector that points to the bottom side of the object.
method.return: The new direction vector.

method.name: getLeft
method.description: Returns the direction vector that points to the left side of the object.
method.return: The new direction vector.

method.name: getMaterialByName
method.description: Returns the first material that matches the specified name.
method.param: name Name of the material to be searched for.
includeChildren true to extend the search to all the object hierarchy.
method.return: The material that matches the specified name.

method.name: getPosition
method.description: Returns the current position of the object.
method.return: A new vector with the current position of the object.

method.name: getRight
method.description: Returns the direction vector that points to the right side of the object.
method.return: The new direction vector.

method.name: getRotation
method.description: Returns the current rotation of the object in euler angles.
method.return: A new vector with the current rotation of the object.

method.name: getScale
method.description: Returns the current scale of the object.
method.return: A new vector with the current scale of the object.

method.name: getScreenCoords
method.description:
Returns the coordinates of an object with respect to the screen.
The returned values are relative to the viewPort size that is currently used.
method.param: out If a vector is specified, this vector will be filled with the returned values.
method.return: The vector with the coordinates.

method.name: getUp
method.description: Returns the direction vector that points to the upper side of the object.
method.return: The new direction vector.

method.name: globalToLocalVector
method.description: Transforms a point of the global space of the object into a local space without translation. Useful to convert direction normals or vectors.
method.param: point The point to be transformed.
out Vector3D where the transformed point will be returned. If null, a new Vector3D is returned.
method.return: Vector3D with the transformed point.

method.name: globalToLocal
method.description: Transforms a point of the global space of the object into a local space.
method.param: point The point to be transformed.
out Vector3D where the transformed point will be returned. If null, a new Vector3D is returned.
method.return: Vector3D with the transformed point.

method.name: gotoAndPlay
method.description: Starts playing the animation at the specified frame
method.param: frame Frame number at which animation will be started. Animation frames are zero-based.
blendFrames The number of frames to use to blend from the current state to the new animation frame.
animationMode The mode to use to play the animation. Should be one of the consntants ANIMATION_LOOP_MODE, ANIMATION_PING_PONG_MODE or ANIMATION_STOP_MODE from Pivot3D.

method.name: gotoAndStop
method.description: Stops the animation at the specified frame.
method.param: frame Frame number at which animation will be stopped. Animation frames are zero-based.

method.name: hide
method.description: Sets whether the object is visible. Only affects the current object.

method.name: localToGlobalVector
method.description: Transforms a point of the local space of the object into a global space without translation. Useful to convert direction normals or vectors.
method.param: point The point to be transformed.
out Vector3D where the transformed point will be returned. If null, a new Vector3D is returned.
method.return: Vector3D with the transformed point.

method.name: localToGlobal
method.description: Transforms a point of the local space into the global space.
method.param: point The point to be transformed.
out The Vector3D where the transformed point will be returned. If null, a new Vector3D is returned.
method.return: If the out parameter is null, a new Vector3D object with the transformed point will be returned, or the same out vector.

method.name: lookAt
method.description: Directs the object towards the specified position. Coordinates are related to the local space of the object.
method.param: x Position on x
y Position on Y
z Position on z
up Vector3D related to the direction of the upper side of the object. The default value is (0, 1, 0).
smooth Optional interpolation value towards final transformation (0-1).

method.name: removeChild
method.description: Removes a child of the object.
method.param: pivot Object to be removed.
method.return: The object that has been removed.

method.name: removeComponent
method.description: Removes a component from the object.
method.param: component The component to remove.
method.return: 'true' if the component was sucesfully removed, 'false' otherwise or if the components was in the components list..

method.name: removeLabel
method.description: Removes a label.
method.param: label Label3D object to be removed.
includeChildren true if the labels of all the sub-objects are to be removed.
method.return: The label has been removed.

method.name: replaceMaterial
method.description: Replaces an existing material of the object with another material.
method.param: source Material that is to be replaced.
replaceFor Material that is to replace the previous one.
includeChildren true if children are to be included.

method.name: resetTransforms
method.description: Resets the object position, rotation and scale.

method.name: rotateAxis
method.description:
Rotates the object on the specified axis from its current position.
The pivotPoint parameter can be used to rotate around a point.
method.param: angle Angles to be rotated
axis Direction vector or axis on which to rotate.
pivotPoint Position vector that sets an anchoring point for rotation. The position must be expressed in local units.

method.name: rotateX
method.description:
Rotates the object on the X axis from its current position.
The pivotPoint parameter can be used to rotate around a point.
method.param: angle Angles to be rotated.
local true to rotate respecting current orientation, or false to rotate according to orientation relative to parent.
pivotPoint Position vector that sets an anchoring point for rotation. The position must be expressed in local units.

method.name: rotateY
method.description:
Rotates the object on the Y axis from its current position.
The pivotPoint parameter can be used to rotate around a point.
method.param: angle Angles to be rotated.
local true to rotate respecting current orientation, or false to rotate according to orientation relative to parent.
pivotPoint Position vector that sets an anchoring point for rotation. The position must be expressed in local units.

method.name: rotateZ
method.description:
Rotates the pivot on the Z axis from its current position.
The pivotPoint parameter can be used to rotate around a point.
method.param: angle Angles to be rotated.
local true to rotate respecting current orientation, or false to rotate according to orientation relative to parent.
pivotPoint Position vector that sets an anchoring point for rotation. The position must be expressed in local units.

method.name: setLayer
method.description: Sets the layer to render the object and all of his children.
method.param: value The layer index.
includeChildren true to apply the same value to all the object hierarchy.

method.name: setMaterial
method.description: Sets a material for the object and, optionally, all its descendants. The material will only affect Mesh3D objects that contain the Pivot3D.
method.param: material Material that will be assigned.
includeChildren true if all the hierarchy is to be included.

method.name: setNormalOrientation
method.description: Aligns the object to a normal.
method.param: normal Normal used for alignment.
smooth Optional interpolation value (0-1).

method.name: setOrientation
method.description: Orients the object in a specific direction.
method.param: dir Direction set for orientation.
up Upper side of the object. The default value is (0,1,0).
smooth Optional interpolation value (0-1).

method.name: setPosition
method.description: Sets the position of the object.
method.param: x Position on x
y Position on y
z Position on z
smooth Optional interpolation value towards final transformation (0-1).

method.name: setRotation
method.description: Sets the object rotation using euler angles. Rotation is absolute, so any previous rotation will be ignored.
method.param: x Rotation on x in angles.
y Rotation on y in angles.
z Rotation on z in angles.

method.name: setScale
method.description:
Sets the object scale. This method sets the scale in an absolute manner; therefore, any previous scale will be ignored.
Default value is 1, use a value greater than one to increase or less than 1 to decrease the scale.
Setting the scale to 2 means that objects will be scaled to twice their original size, whereas a value of 0.5 would scale objects to one half of their original size.
method.param: x Scale on x
y Scale on y
z Scale on z

method.name: setTranslation
method.description: Translates the object from its current position to the specified distance.
method.param: x Distance in units to translate on X axis.
y Distance in units to translate on Y axis.
z Distance in units to translate on Z axis.
local true to translate respecting current orientation or false to translate on the coordinates relative to the parent.

method.name: show
method.description: Sets whether the object is visible. Only affects the current object.

method.name: startDrag
method.description: Lets the user drag the specified Pivot3D. The Pivot3D remains draggable until explicitly stopped through a call to the Pivot3D.stopDrag() method, or until another Pivot3D is made draggable. Only one Pivot3D is draggable at a time.
method.param: lockCenter
reference

method.name: stopDrag
method.description: Ends the startDrag() method. A Pivot3D that was made draggable with the startDrag() method remains draggable until a stopDrag() method is added, or until another Pivot3D becomes draggable. Only one Pivot3D is draggable at a time.

method.name: translateAxis
method.description: Translates the object on a certain axis from its current position.
method.param: distance Distance to translate.
axis Direction vector or axis on which to translate.

method.name: translateX
method.description: Translates the object on the X axis from its current position.
method.param: distance Distance to translate.
local true to translate respecting current orientation, or false to translate on the coordinates relative to parent.

method.name: translateY
method.description: Translates the object on the Y axis from its current position.
method.param: distance Distance to translate.
local true to translate respecting current orientation, or false to translate on the coordinates relative to parent.

method.name: translateZ
method.description: Translates the object on the Z axis from its current position.
method.param: distance Distance to translate.
local true to translate respecting current orientation, or false to translate on the coordinates relative to parent.

method.name: updateTransforms
method.description: This method is used to force the system to update the object in those cases where its matrices have been modified manually.
method.param: includeChildren true to include all the hierarchy.

method.name: upload
method.param: scene
force

method.name: children
method.description: Returns a Pivot3D-type vector with its children.

method.name: currentFrame
method.description: Returns or sets the frame number where the pivot is situated. Animation frames are zero-based.

method.name: frameSpeed
method.description:
Returns or sets animation speed. The default value is 1.
The frame number is increased by the frameSpeed value in each update (update event) and is directly related to the number of updates per second in Device3D.

method.name: invWorld
method.description:
Returns a matrix with the inverse global position, rotation and scale of the object.
If the object is part of a hierarchy that has been moved, rotated, scaled, etc., this property will return the matrix
relative to the furthest parent that can be found. In general, this could be the scene.

method.name: isPlaying
method.description: Returns true if an animation is being played.

method.name: parent
method.description:
Returns or sets the objects parent.
Setting the parent through the parent property has the same effect as establishing the parent property with the AddChild method of the Pivot3D that will be parent.
It can remove parent object by setting the parent property to null.

method.name: scaleX
method.description:
Increases or decreases the object scale on the X axis from its current scale.
Use a value greater than one to increase or less than one to decrease.
Setting the scale to 2 means that objects will be scaled to twice their original size, whereas a value of 0.5 would scale objects to one half of their original size.

method.name: scaleY
method.description:
Increases or decreases the object scale on the Y axis from its current scale.
Use a value greater than one to increase or less than one to decrease.
Setting the scale to 2 means that objects will be scaled to twice their original size, whereas a value of 0.5 would scale objects to one half of their original size.

method.name: scaleZ
method.description:
Increases or decreases the object scale on the Z axis from its current scale.
Use a value greater than one to increase or less than one to decrease.
Setting the scale to 2 means that objects will be scaled to twice their original size, whereas a value of 0.5 would scale objects to one half their original size.

method.name: scene
method.description: Gets a reference to the scene that contains the object.

method.name: sortMode
method.description: Gets ot sets the sorting mode for the object.

method.name: visible
method.description: Sets or returns whether the object is visible. If the visible property is set false, the object will be hidden and so will all its descendants.

method.name: world
method.description:
Returns a matrix with the global position, rotation and scale of the object.
If the object is part of a hierarchy that has been moved, rotated, scaled, etc., this property will return the matrix
relative to the furthest parent that can be found. In general, this could be the scene.
The world matrix, instead, represents the local position, rotation and scale.
If the world matrix has been manually modified, it will have to call the updateTransforms method to update the global matrix.

method.name: x
method.description: Returns or sets the position on the X axis.

method.name: y
method.description: Returns or sets the position on the Y axis.

method.name: z
method.description: Returns or sets the position on the Z axis.

field.name: ADDED_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the 'added' event.

field.name: ADDED_TO_SCENE_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the 'addedToScene' event.

field.name: ANIMATION_COMPLETE_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the 'animationComplete' event.

field.name: ENTER_DRAW_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the 'enterDraw' event.

field.name: ENTER_FRAME_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the 'enterFrame' event.

field.name: EXIT_DRAW_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the 'exitDraw' event.

field.name: EXIT_FRAME_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the 'exitFrame' event.

field.name: REMOVED_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the 'removed' event.

field.name: REMOVED_FROM_SCENE_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the 'removedFromScene' event.

field.name: UNLOAD_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the 'unload' event.

field.name: UPDATE_TRANSFORM_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the 'updateTransform' event.

field.name: _lock
field.description:
Sets the pivot lock mode. When a pivot is locked, it will not be updated / played directly and will not dispatch events like enter and exit frame.
This is usually the case on bones, that they are updated trough an external controller.

field.name: animationEnabled
field.description: Activates or deactivates the animation. If the object is animated and this animation is being placed, the element will be blocked by the animation and will not be able to move or rotate manually; therefore, if an animated object is to be controlled, the animation must first be disabled by setting animationEnabled false.

field.name: components
field.description: A collection vector that contains all the components of the object.

field.name: dirty
field.description: Gets or sets when the object has changed his transform matrix by hand.

field.name: frames
field.description: Vector that contains all the animation frames.

field.name: labels
field.description: Returns or sets an object that contains the Labels3D objects used to play and manage animations.

field.name: layer
field.description: Gets or sets the layer to render the object.

field.name: name
field.description: Sets or returns the object name.

field.name: priority
field.description: This value is for internal use to calculate the priority acording the distance from the camera during the render.

field.name: transform
field.description: Sets or returns the matrix of local position, rotation and scale. The world property corresponds to the local space of the object.

field.name: userData
field.description: Sets or returns an object for free use by the user. The userData object may also contain variables included within the f3d files.

classRec.name: Light3D
classRec.description:
The Light3D class represents a 3d light.
Lights will have an effect on the materials that admit them.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: setParams
method.description: Sets the light properties.

field.name: DIRECTIONAL
field.description: Constant that defines a directional light.

field.name: POINT
field.description: Constant that defines a point light.

field.name: attenuation
field.description: Sets or returns light attenuation.

field.name: color
field.description: Sets or returns light color.

field.name: infinite
field.description:
Sets and returns if the light is infinite or not.
Set it to true for ambient lights.
Directional lights are always infinite.

field.name: multiplier
field.description: Light color multipler.

field.name: radius
field.description: Sets or returns light radius.

field.name: sample
field.description: The BitmapData to use for light projections.

field.name: type
field.description: Type of light (point/directional)

classRec.name: Mesh3D
classRec.description: The Mesh3D class contains the data (geometry, materials, modifiers) instances which can be drawn a 3d object.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: Mesh3D
method.description: Creates a new Mesh3D object.
method.param: name Mesh name.
geometry Geometry3D instance.

method.name: updateBoundings
method.description: Forces to update mesh boundings.

method.name: bounds
method.description: Returns or sets a Boundings3D object with object properties, such as radius, dimensions, etc.

field.name: modifier
field.description: Modifier instance used to process and project vertices.

field.name: mouseEnabled
field.description: Enables the mouse interaction with the object. If any mouse related event is added trough addEventListener method, this property will automatically be seted to 'true'.

field.name: surfaces
field.description: Instance to the Surface3D class.

field.name: useHandCursor
field.description: Value that defines whether the hand cursor is to display when events such as MouseEvent3D.MOUSE_OVER or MouseEvent3D.MOUSE_MOVE are defined. The default value is false.

classRec.name: Camera3D
classRec.description:
The Camera3D class represents the point of view and orientation of the scene.

There can be as many cameras as required, but the one selected in the scene will do the rendering.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: getPointDir
method.description: Returns a global 3D direction vector relative to a 2D camera position.
method.param: x The x position over the camera viewport.
y The y position over the camera viewport.
out A reference vector to return the direction vector.
method.return: If the 'out' is 'null', a new vector will be returned. Otherwise, the same vector, passed to the 'out' parameter, will be returned.

method.name: updateProjectionMatrix
method.description: Updates the camera projection matrix.

method.name: aspectRatio
method.description: Sets or returns the aspect ratio of the camera.

method.name: far
method.description:
Sets or returns the furthest clip plane from the camera. The higher the value, the further the camera will view.
This value corresponds to the distance between the camera and the plane.
Everything beyond that distance is not to be rendered.
For optimization purposes, complex scenes with a large number of polygons should not have a
high value to avoid the unnecessary rendering of objects that are too far.

method.name: fieldOfView
method.description:
Sets and returns the cameras angle of view. The angle of view is inversely proportional
to the zoom. The wider the angle, the closer the projection plane and, therefore, the shorter the zoom.

method.name: near
method.description:
Sets or returns the clip plane that is closest to the camera. Its value must be greater than zero.
Everything beyond this virtual plane is not to be rendered.
The value corresponds to the distance between the camera and the plane.
This value should be set at the furthest possible point from the camera. This is likely to result in improved performance,
especially in those situations where objects go through the camera plane.

method.name: projection
method.description: Returns the projection matrix.

method.name: viewProjection
method.description: Returns the viewProjection matrix.

method.name: view
method.description: Returns the view matrix.

method.name: zoom
method.description: Sets or returns the camera zoom. The zoom is the distance between the point of origin of the camera and the projection plane.

method.name: canvasSize
method.description:
Defines the projection area for the camera viewPort.
If no canvasSize is defined, the values from scene viewPort are used.
This property could be used in case where you need to render to a texture that has
different dimensions that the scene viewport.

method.name: viewPort
method.description: Defines the area where the camera will draw. This area is relative to the scene viewport or canvasSize if it is defined.

field.name: clipRectangle
field.description: Define whatever the viewPort clip all pixels outside the viewPort.

classRec.name: Particles3D
classRec.description: The Particles3D class creates billboard particle effects.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: Particles3D
method.description: Creates a new particles emitter.
method.param: name The name of the particles object.

method.name: build
method.description: Builds and initializes the particles buffers. You should not call to this method unless you explicity want to build the buffers manually.

method.name: draw
method.param: includeChildren
material

method.name: pause
method.description: Pauses the emission of particles.

method.name: resume
method.description: Resumes the emission of particles after being paused.

method.name: setAlphas
method.description: Sets the values to use as an alpha channel for all particles to use over the time.
method.param: alphas alphas: An array of alpha values for the corresponding colors in the colors array; valid values go from 0 to 1. The value will be clamped between 0 and 1.

ratios: An array of color distribution ratios; valid values go from 0 to 255. This value defines the percentage of the width where the color is sampled at 100%. The value 0 represents the initial position, and 255 represents the final position.

method.name: setColors
method.description: Set the colors for the particles over the time.
method.param: colors An array of RGB hexadecimal color values to be used in the gradient; for example, red is 0xFF0000, blue is 0x0000FF, and so on. You can specify up to 15 colors. For each color, be sure you specify a corresponding value in the alphas and ratios parameters.

ratios An array of color distribution ratios; valid values are 0 to 255. This value defines the percentage of the width where the color is sampled at 100%. The value 0 represents the initial position, and 255 represents the final position.

method.name: start
method.description:
Starts the emission of particles.
This method reinitializes the buffers when worldPositions or worldVelocities are set to true, and may affect performance when using it with large amount of particles.

method.name: alphaRatios
method.description: Get the ratios used for the alpha channel.

method.name: alphas
method.description: Gets the alpha values of the alpha channel.

method.name: area
method.description: Gets or sets the emitter area where the particles are born. Big values might be needed for the effect to be noticeable.

method.name: blendMode
method.description: Gets or sets the blend mode used for the particles. Should be one of the blending constants defined in Particle3D class.

method.name: colorRatios
method.description: Gets the color ratios used for the gradient color channel.

method.name: colors
method.description: Gets the colors used for the gradient color channel.

method.name: delay
method.description: Gets or sets a delay interval for the particles creation, expressed in seconds.

method.name: endSize
method.description: Gets or sets the final size of the particle.

method.name: energy
method.description:
Gets or sets the starting velocity of the particles, working as a range value.
For example a value of 100, 0, 0 means that particles will be dispatched in a range of -100 to 100 in x-axis.

method.name: gravity
method.description: Gets or sets the gravity vector of the emitter.

method.name: hemisphere
method.description: Gets or sets whatever the particles energy should dispatch in all directions or only up to the floor plane.

method.name: loops
method.description: Gets ot sets the number of cylces for the emitter.

method.name: numParticles
method.description: Gets or sets the number of particles to be used.

method.name: randomFrame
method.description: Gets or sets whether the particles should use a random frame from the textureFrams property.

method.name: randomScale
method.description: Gets or sets a random scale range value for each particle.

method.name: randomSpin
method.description: Gets or sets a random spin range value for each particle.

method.name: randomVelocity
method.description: Gets or sets a random velocity range value for each particle.

method.name: shots
method.description:
Gets or sets the number of particles interval to emit trough the emitter duration.
A value of zero means that particles are dispatched continuously.

method.name: sortMode
method.description: Gets or sets the sorting mode for the particles. Should be one of the constants defined in Particles3D.

method.name: spin
method.description: Gets or sets a start spin value for all particles.

method.name: startSize
method.description: Gets or sets the start size of all particles.

method.name: textureFrames
method.description: Gets or sets the number of frames in x and y axis of the texture.

method.name: texture
method.description: Gets or sets the base particle texture to use for all particles.

method.name: time
method.description: Gets or sets the current emitter time, expressed in seconds.

method.name: useRandomColors
method.description: Gets or sets whether the particles should use any random color based on the range provided in setColors method.

method.name: velocity
method.description: Gets or sets the initial velocity for all particles.

method.name: worldPositions
method.description: Gets or sets if the particles positions should be linked to the emitter as a regular child or they're parented the world coordinates.

method.name: worldVelocities
method.description: Gets or sets if the particles velocities should be linked to the emitter as a regular child or they are parented the world coordinates.

method.name: blendTexture
method.description: Gets or sets a blending texture to use trough the particle's life.

method.name: gravityPower
method.description: Gets or sets the curve intensity to use for the gravity parameter.

field.name: duration
field.description: Gets or sets the cycle length of the emitter. In seconds.

field.name: initParticleFunction
field.description:
Gets or sets a custom callback function to initializate the particles.
The function should receive the emitter, the particle index and the init properties objects.
For example: myCustomParticles( emitter:Particles3D, index:int, init:ParticleInit3D ):void
Inside the function, you can change the init particle properties such as position, velocity, etc.

classRec.name: Shape3D
classRec.description: The Shape3D class represents a set of splines (Spline3D).
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad

method.name: Shape3D
method.description: Creates a new set of splines.
method.param: name Object name.

method.name: getPoint
method.description:
Returns the position on the spline depending on the value parameter.
This method will take into consideration all the splines (Spline3D) that are contained in the Shape3D.
For example, if two Spline3D objects are contained, a value ranging from 0.0 to 0.5 in the value parameter will locate the resulting
position on the first spline, whereas a value ranging from 0.5 to 1.0 will locate the resulting position on the second spline.
method.param: value 0 to 1 value that represents the position in time on the spline.
global Sets whether the value will be returned in the global space or local space of the Shape3D. The default value is 'true'.
out Vector where the position will be returned.
method.return: If an 'out' value has been specified, the same object is returned. Otherwise, a new vector with the position is returned.

method.name: getTangent
method.description:
Returns the direction on the spline in a given position.
This method will take into consideration all the splines (Spline3D) that are contained in the Shape3D.
For example, if two Spline3D objects are contained, a value ranging from 0.0 to 0.5 in the value parameter will locate the resulting
position on the first spline, whereas a value ranging from 0.5 to 1.0 will locate the resulting position on the second spline.
method.param: value 0 to 1 value that represents the position in time on the spline.
global Sets whether the value will be returned in the global space or local space of the Shape3D. The default value is 'true'.
out Vector where the direction will be returned.
method.return: If an 'out' value has been specified, the same object is returned. Otherwise, a new vector with the position is returned.

field.name: color
field.description: Gets or sets the shape line color.

field.name: splines
field.description: Spline3D-type vector with the splines contained in the Shape3D.

classRec.name: Lines3D
classRec.description: The Lines3D class is a helper to work with 3D pixel thickness lines.

classRec.name: Scene3D
classRec.description:
The Scene3D class is the main element, container and manager of all the 3d resources and objects.

The Scene3D class also has a Clock3D instance that manages update and render cycles. The update event indicates the need to update scene elements and the render and postRender events allow full control before and after the render process.

Once the scene has been created, use addChild or addChildFromFile to include 3d objects. This will dispatch the progress and complete events to control the loading process for external files.

The scene also creates a Camera3D object to view the scene. The canvas size will take Stage size values by default. To change the rendering area size, use the setViewport method.

Event.name: ioError
Event.description: Dispatched if a call to load() results in a fatal error that terminates the download.

Event.name: progress
Event.description: This event occurs whenever the loading progress of the elements of a scene is modified.

Event.name: complete
Event.description: This event occurs once the loading process of all the scene elements has been completed.

Event.name: postRender
Event.description: This event occurs after rendering the scene.

Event.name: render
Event.description: This event occurs before rendering the scene.

Event.name: update
