Event.description: This event occurs whenever the program must be updated. This event is synchronized with the frames-per-second rate defined in Device3D and bit rate is constant.

method.name: Scene3D
method.description: Create a new Scene3D object.
method.param: container Object that will serve as container to render the scene. Preferably, it should be an empty MovieClip or Sprite. It must not be rotated or scaled.

file Optional name of the ~~.f3d file to be loaded into the scene. The file parameter is optional. If null, an empty scene is created. More ~~.f3d files can be subsequently added using the addChild or addChildFromFile method.

method.name: addChildFromFile
method.description: Loads and adds a Flare3D (~~.f3d) file from an external file.
method.param: file File path.

parent pivot that will serve as container for the objects in the file.
If parent is null, a container with the name of the file to be added to the scene is created.
method.return: The Flare3DLoader object that loads the file. The loaded elements will become available only after the complete event of the scene.

method.name: addTextureFromFile
method.description: Loads a texture from an external file.
method.param: file File path.
method.return: The loaded texture. The texture will become available after the complete event of the scene.

method.name: freeMemory
method.description:
Forces to free all unused memory.
When you upload multiple files, textures, materials into the GPU, those resources will remain active until you release them.

method.name: getPointScreenCoords
method.description:
Returns the coordinates of an arbitrary world point respect to the screen.
The returned values are relative to the viewPort size that is currently used.
method.param: out If a vector is specified, this vector will be filled with the returned values.
method.return: The vector with the coordinates.

method.name: pause
method.description: Pauses the update event and starts shooting the paused event.

method.name: render
method.description:
Renders the current scene frame. This method is called by the scene automatically but can force the rendering if necessary or if the scene is paused.
This method also will dispatch the scene 'render' event but not the 'postRender' event.

method.name: resume
method.description: Exits pause mode.

method.name: setLayerSortMode
method.description:
Specifies a layer to be sorted per object on each frame. This is very useful to draw correctly alpha objects that needs to be sorted.
This property is property is used in conjunction with Pivot3D sortMode property.
method.param: layer Index of the layer to be sorted.
mode The sort mode should be one of the constants SORT_FRONT_TO_BACK, SORT_BACK_TO_FRONT or SORT_NONE.

method.name: setViewport
method.description: Sets the dimensions of the canvas rendering area.
method.param: x left maring of rendering area in pixels.
y Top maring of rendering area in pixels.
width Width of rendering area in pixels.
height Height of rendering area in pixels.

antialias an int selecting anti-aliasing quality. 0 is no anti-aliasing. Correlates to the number of sub-samples; a value of 2 is generally the minimum, although some systems with anti-alias with a value of one. More anti-aliasing is more depanding on the GPU and may impact performance.

method.name: setupConstants
method.description: Updates global constants for each frame.

method.name: setupFrame
method.description:
This method prepares the scene to be rendered.
The render method call to this before render. You should only use this function if you want to
draw manually specific objects.
method.param: camera

method.name: updateMouseEvents
method.description: This method forces to update mouse events for all 3D objects in the scene.

method.name: update
method.description: Forces to update the scene and animations and will dispatch the scene 'update' event.

method.name: antialias
method.description: An int selecting anti-aliasing quality. 0 is no anti-aliasing. Correlates to the number of sub-samples; a value of 2 is generally the minimum, although some systems with anti-alias with a value of one. More anti-aliasing is more depanding on the GPU and may impact performance.

method.name: camera
method.description: Sets or returns the camera to be used for rendering.

method.name: context
method.description: Returns the context used for rendering.

method.name: enableUpdateAndRender
method.description:
Enables or disable the automatic update, render and postRender events of the scene.
Seting this property to false will allow you to manage your own update and render loop, calling to those methods manually.

method.name: frameRate
method.description: Gets and sets the frame rate of the 3d scene only for the "update" event. The frame rate is defined as frames per second.

method.name: loadProgress
method.description:
Gets the global loading process of the scene.
The returned value is a percent value between 0 and 100.

method.name: paused
method.description: Returns 'true' if the scene is paused.

method.name: renderList
method.description: Gets access to the render list.

method.name: renderTime
method.description:
Returns time taken to render the scene, including lights, object occlusion, drawing, etc.., in milliseconds.
The returned time, does not include the present call.

method.name: rendersPerSecond
method.description: Returns the rendering frame rate for statistical purposes.

method.name: stageIndex
method.description: Gets the associated Stage3D index.

method.name: updateList
method.description: Gets access to the update list.

method.name: updateTime
method.description: Returns the time taken to update the scene in milliseconds.

method.name: updatesPerSecond
method.description: Returns the update frame rate for statistical purposes.

method.name: viewPort
method.description: Gets the viewport area associated to the Stage3D.

method.name: autoResize
method.description:
This property forces to the scene to take the stage dimensions when the stage is resized if is setted to true.
Also changes the stage.align to topLeft and sets the stage.scaleMode to noScale.

method.name: mouseEnabled
method.description: Enables or disable all mouse scene events.

method.name: showLogo
method.description:
Shows or hides the Flare3D watermak logo for debugging purposes.
This property only works on comercial versions of Flare3D or if the content is running using a Flash Player Debugger version.
If the library is a trial version and the content is runnung under a Flash Player release version, this property will not take any effect.

method.name: showMenu
method.description:
Shows or hides the Flare3D version on the right click menu.
This property should be setted inmediaelly after the scene creation.

field.name: COMPLETE_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the complete event.

field.name: PAUSED_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the paused event.

field.name: POSTRENDER_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the postRender event.

field.name: PROGRESS_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the progress event.

field.name: RENDER_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the render event.

field.name: UPDATE_EVENT
field.description: Defines the value for the update event.

field.name: clearColor
field.description: Color to use to clear the back buffer.

field.name: ignoreInvisibleUnderMouse
field.description: Allow to detect mouse events with non visible objects such as references or simplified geometry.

field.name: library
field.description: Library3D instance that manages all scene resources.

field.name: lights
field.description: A reference to a LightFilter that manage all scene lights.

field.name: skipFrames
field.description:
When is set to true, the scene will maintain a constant
update framerate (based on scene.frameRate property), but render frames could be skipped to
keep the framerate constant (recommended for games).
Otherwise, theh update and render will be synchronized with the enterFrame event (better sittuated for simple visualizations).
By default is true.

classRec.name: Viewer3D
classRec.description: The Viewer3D class adds basic functionalities to the scene for camera control and easier 3d object viewing.
classRec.author: Ariel Nehmad
